sense.name: conversation
sense.commentary: DIALOGUE[+event] a conversation between two persons
sense.examples: They agreed to take the heated dialogue outside. Their dialogue lasted almost two hours.

sense.name: lines of speech
sense.commentary: the lines spoken by characters in a drama; or a literary composition in the form of a conversation between two people
sense.examples: He has read Plato's Dialogues in the original Greek. It took her only three hours to memorize all of the dialogue in the play. He bought a kit designed to help him overcome clumsy dialogue. The convoluted dialogue made the movie difficult to understand.

sense.name: negotiations
sense.commentary: DIALOGUE[+event] talks - a discussion intended to produce an agreement
sense.examples: The buyout dialogue lasted several days. They disagreed but kept an open dialogue. Dialogue between Israelis and Palestinians...
